title: Items with mana on manaless champs?
body: What if items with Mana got their Mana converted into a gold equivalent amount of Health on manaless champs? Obviously it wouldn't work for items like {{item:3070}} but it would be nice for items like {{item:3078}} {{item:3800}} {{item:3001}} {{item:3100}}  on manaless champs like {{champion:82}}. I just want some better options as an AP bruiser, since that subclass doesn't get much love.

replies.body: Hell no, i can already see {{champion:55}}  with {{item:3285}} {{item:3100}}

> Hell no, i can already see {{champion:55}}  with {{item:3285}} {{item:3100}}

Could adjust champs if they become too strong. It would just be nice to have more options.

If they have to adjust champions over it, then you're enforcing situations where manaless champions have to build a mana based build to be balanced. That's counter intuitive and wrong on so many levels.

> If you don't see them building these items then why bother converting mana to health at all?

Like I said in OP, for champs like {{champion:82}} .

And like I said, it doesn't make sense to force a manaless champion into mana item builds because a particular item combination ends up being too strong and gets the champion nerfed.

You're arguing it would diversify builds. I'm arguing that it could restrict builds after the inevitable nerfs come.

he's right you know. if they did this, it would make lich bane a priority on kat and you'd probably see kats getting it first item, if not at least second. then you nerf kat because of the item, and you have a shitty situation where there were lots of kats who don't even like to auto.
why not make it attack speed?

This is a hard no. We don't need shit like Tank Yasuo, Tank Akali, Tank Zed, Tank Katarina, and god knows who else because they decide to build items with mana.

you can still get lich on morde if you really want... tbh the 250 mana on it isn't even that big of a deal in comparison to what people actually use it for. I see triforce the same way, cept for cases like EZs in which you also build mana for manamune and seraph's. 
like if you're at the point where you might feel like it would be a good idea to get and use these items on a manaless champ, you probably could tbqh... the mana pool in LoL has always been super crazy large and forgiving to begin with, and isn't something people necessarily HAVE to itemize into like dota. in the end the flat AP among other benefits are what really brings the items their viability.

Turn the mana into crit chance
